alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 11:13AM MDT until June 10 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Wednesday and Thursday afternoon and evening rainfall over the southern Wind River Range produced rises of a little less than one foot on the Little Popo Agie River from Red Canyon through Lyons Valley. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including in Lyons Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1106 AM MDT, the Little Popo Agie River near Red Canyon had crested on Thursday and is slowly falling. Water levels in Lyons Valley indicated a rise to minor flood stage late Thursday, but have now dropped slightly to action stage, which should stay at this level into Saturday. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Popo Agie River drainage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyons Valley.
info.instruction: Do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
